intro: Danaea trichomanoides, commonly known as the flame flower, is a member of the Commelinaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble flames, composed of bright red or orange bracts. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth, waxy surface. Danaea trichomanoides thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
